content: The following lists events that happened during **1977 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### February - 27 February – The [Upper Peirce Reservoir](/wiki/Upper_Peirce_Reservoir) is officially opened as Singapore's fourth reservoir. On the same day, a [10-year plan to clean up the Singapore River](/wiki/Singapore_River#Pollution_and_cleanup) is announced by the late [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew). ### May - 28 May – Singapore defeats [Penang](/wiki/Penang_FA) by 3–2 during the [1977 Malaysia Cup](/wiki/Malaysia_Cup) match at [Stadium Merdeka](/wiki/Stadium_Merdeka), [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur). ### June - 13 June – The first [double-decker bus](/wiki/Double-decker_bus#Singapore) is launched on service 86 by Singapore Bus Service (now [SBS Transit](/wiki/SBS_Transit)). ### July - 23 July – [Big Splash](/wiki/Big_Splash,_Singapore) opens in [East Coast Park](/wiki/East_Coast_Park) as a [waterpark](/wiki/Waterpark). - 31 July – [Senoko Power Station](/wiki/Senoko_Power_Station) is officially opened as Singapore's fifth power station. ### December - 10 December – The [Science Centre Singapore](/wiki/Science_Centre_Singapore) (then Singapore Science Centre) is officially opened. - 12 December – The [Singapore Labour Foundation](/wiki/Singapore_Labour_Foundation) is formed to ensure families in unions are well-taken care of, as well as to promote union groups in Singapore. ### Date unknown – The [World Trade Centre](/wiki/HarbourFront_Centre) is completed. ## Births - 17 April – - Jaime Teo, artiste and singer, co-founder of [Twelve Cupcakes](/wiki/Twelve_Cupcakes). - [Jamie Yeo](/wiki/Jamie_Yeo), artiste and radio DJ. - 22 April – [Michelle Chong](/wiki/Michelle_Chong), producer and director. - 18 July – [Alfian Sa'at](/wiki/Alfian_Sa%27at), playwright. ## Deaths - 5 February – [Tan Siak Kew](/wiki/Tan_Siak_Kew), prominent businessman, nominated member of the [Legislative Assembly](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore), president of the [Singapore Chinese Chamber of Commerce](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Chamber_of_Commerce_and_Industry), diplomat and philanthropist (b. 1903). - 14 February – N. Govindasamy, [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) Member of Parliament for [Radin Mas Constituency](/wiki/Radin_Mas_Single_Member_Constituency) (b. 1928). - 4 July – [Michael Olcomendy](/wiki/Michel_Ol%C3%A7omendy), 1st [Catholic Archbishop of Singapore](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Singapore) (b. 1901). - 3 August – [Lim Guan Hoo](/wiki/Lim_Guan_Hoo), Parliamentary Secretary to the [Ministry of Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) and [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) Member of Parliament for [Bukit Merah Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Constituency) (b. 1939). - 12 October – [Francis Thomas](/wiki/Francis_Thomas_(politician)), former principal of [Saint Andrew's School](/wiki/Saint_Andrew%27s_Secondary_School) and former Minister of Communications and Works (b. 1912). - 15 November – [Pang Tee Pow](/wiki/Pang_Tee_Pow), 4th [Chairman of the Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board#Senior_leadership) (b. 1928). - 27 December – Soh Ghee Soon, former [LSP](/wiki/Liberal_Socialist_Party_(Singapore)) legislative assemblyman for [Cairnhill Constituency](/wiki/Cairnhill_Constituency) (b. 1903).
